text: must be really challenging to come up with favorites with so many genres to choose from.

text: gorgeous. I really felt as though I was there when I played this game.

text: Hey listen! I mean, let's hook up and sail the seven seas!
author: knasbollicus

text: I got WWHD with my Wii U purchase, I didn't really play it much on GameCube so I look forward to playing it more now on Wii U. I liked Twilight Princess a lot, and Skyward Sword less (though it is fantastic too). Hopefully I will have a blast :)
author: Pascal Pimpare

text: My favorite Zelda game. Just so beautiful and happy...
author: Kino the Babe

text: Reminds me of finding Chozo Artifacts in Metroid Prime, and that was actually kinda praised. Some of the islands in the triforce quest had some pretty cool features.
author: Alfonso ST

text: I didn't think that the dungeons were that bad. For me, Skyward Sword had the weakest dungeons out of all the 3D Zeldas.

text: Oh, that sure is different and interesting! Thanks!

on this i disagree with you...

author: Tywin Lannister

text: This is just Kokiri Forest slowed down? That just blew my mind...
author: EricKirby1

text: glad to see so much love for WW here. Anytime i get into a discussion about Zelda, i practically get lynched because Ocarina of Time isn't my favorite one. It isn't even second. Link to the past comes first, then Wind Waker
author: Gorilla Games

text: If you listen closely, this is the Kokiri Forest theme slowed down and instrumented differently.
author: CrazyWrench

text: i love it, so chill :)
author: CleverDjembe

text: I feel like noting that I'm currently replaying this game for the first time since 2009, and it might seriously be my favorite game of all time.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: 2nd favorite Zelda here. It'd be #1, but as I said in a previous video, I can't stand that Triforce quest which is also the one thing people complained about they didn't fix. Literally, every little flaw the game had, any issue people had and brought up, WWHD fixed with the exception of the Triforce Quest which is a shame seeing as right next to the sailing that was one of the big ones.
author: Arc13

text: Of course, you are entitled to your opinion, but I love the Forbidden Woods and Earth Temple's ambiance to be superb, as well as the feeling of conquering the world when you top the Tower of the Gods. And the build-up for Ganon's Tower when climbing the stairs after re-beating the bosses and Phantom Ganon rivals Ocarina Of Time's. Twilight's dungeons pretty much all feel like direct rehashes of Waker's, except the ice temple which for me is the least interesting and epic dungeon in Zelda history
author: MayhemMessiah

text: Buy the Wind Waker Wii U bundle. It's already available if you don't care about actually having the box.
author: BubbatheScrub

text: I wonder how many Zelda games will end up on SD's top 30 list. He's already said that his favorite 3D Zeldas were TP & OoT, so those are givens. I think he said LA was his favorite 2D entry, and I'd bet that ALTTP is also likely. Any others? Guess we'll have to wait and see.

author: Patricio Espinoza

text: I'm one of the few who actually enjoyed the triforce quest. I'd never get tired of sailing to new adventures.
author: RoyalGreenTea

text: I always figured it was the grove around the Deku tree, what with the sprout growing outside of the old one and all.
author: Gouzaku Fuwachi

text: Still haven't found all the Triumph Forks... at least the traveling on the boat part is so rewarding.
author: Spectral Sheep

text: I find WW to have the weakest dungeons in any 3D Zelda, but the ocean and its islands give one of the best sense of﻿ adventure I've ever experienced in a video game. Getting your boat and sailing around the ocean (with the music) was magical and liberating. Wind Waker HD looks like the perfect excuse for me to replay this game once I get﻿ a Wii U. As for this track, not everyone notices that it's basically a slow remix of Kokiri Forest! The island is probably a shell of OoT's dead Deku Tree.
author: SupraDarky
